Do you want to see the explanations for the new posing function\n(improved in 0.1.3.2)?
Yes - please show it
No - I don't want to see it now (ask me again next time)
No - I don't want to see it (do not ask me again)
Since this is the first time you are using the new posing interface introduced with 0.1.3.2 beta, let me explain how it works.
What you see on the top right corner of the screen is the posing interface with all the action buttons.
Each posing scene has 8 different images.
Two images from front, two from left side, two back views, two from the right side.
For each direction (front, left, back, right) there is a close-up view and a more wide angled view.
The magnifying glass button with the + is used to move closer to the girl and see her at a different (close-up) angle.
The magnifying glass button with the - is used to move further away from the girl and see her at a different (more distant) angle.
The turn right button is used to tell the girl to turn around clockwise 90.
The turn left button is used to tell the girl to turn around counter clockwise 90.
The camera zoom in button is used to zoom in without changing your position, using only the zoom function of your camera.
The camera zoom out button is used to zoom out without changing your position, using only the zoom function of your camera.
Both camera zoom buttons can be used several times in a row to zoom in or out even further.
When you have zoomed in using the camera zoom, you can move the image by left mouse clicking on the image.
The place you clicked on, will be made the new center of the image (if sufficiently zoomed in).
It takes a little getting used to but when you get the hang of it it works pretty well.
When you've set a new center, the camera zoom in and out will try to maintain the new center as well as possible.
The exit button is the way to leave the posing scene, once you are done with the posing.
Do you want to be asked to see this explanation again next time you are using the posing function?
Yes - please ask me again
No - please don't ask me again
This was all there is to know about the new posing function.\nAnd now: Happy posing!

Inside you find a letter from some kind of lottery. The strange thing is, that you don't remember entering any lottery.
